value.title: Document your Power BI Desktop models with DAX Studio!
value.excerpt: Extract a list of measures, tables, etc, from your Power BI model with DAX Studio.  Download the PPUtility add-in here: http://www.sqlbi.com/tools/power-pivot-utilities  Link to DAX STUDIO: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Our Playlists: - - Join our DAX Fridays! value.title: Download sample datasets and reports for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Sample datasets and reports are great for learning and getting inspiration so in todays video I will share some resources you can download and use right away!  Link to resources: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/sample-datasets#the-power-bi-samples-as-pbix-files and https://github.com/microsoft/powerbi-desktop-samples/tree/master/Sample%20Reports

value.title: Fill down and replace null/blank values in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to troubleshoot fill down and replace blank values.  If you are trying to fill down blank values or replace null values you might see that power query ignores it completely. In this video I will show you how to fix this issues.    Looking for a download file? Go to our

value.title: Fill up/ down with conditions in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to fill up or down based on conditions. I am going to show you two ways to do it, you pick the one need :)  Chapters 00:00 Intro 01:00 First solution using M language 02:50 Second solution using the UI Done!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: How to add ANNOTATIONS to a chart in Power BI to provide an explanation or more context!
value.excerpt: Annotations on charts are helpful for showing when key events occurred, especially when they have a noticeable impact on the data  or to give insights on the numbers in text form to help the reader understand the chart.  In todays video I will show you can you can add annotations to charts automatically

value.title: Convert data from HTML to Plain Text using Power Query for Power BI Table Visualization
value.excerpt: As we all know, Power BI table visualization does not support HTML generation. So, we need to convert our HTML text to Plain text.   With the help of Power Query function, we can easily remove HTML tags from the Text in Power Query. To implement that we need to use function HTML.table() in Power Query.

value.title: DAX Beginners - SUM Vs SUMX in Power BI - What, When and Where?
value.excerpt: Welcome to Wed with Dax beginner series. During this episode, we will talk about two interesting DAX expressions. SUM and SUMX. We will compare both DAX expressions in detail. First, I will explain When to use SUM and when to use SUMX. We will talk about the difference between SUM and SUMX functions
